page.title: 14LOOKING AT KINGSDOWN HOUSE.
page.content: A group of us went to interview Miss Pyke.Miss Pyke lives in part of {Kingsdown House.}When we got there we were greeted by a{peacock}called Alexander who belongs to Miss Pyke. Miss Pyke has lived at Kingsdown House for about 20 years.It was a{mental {home}built from{local stone}in the early 17th century.The other seven parts were built in the 18th century. The fields surrounding the house are mostly{farmland and gardens.}The farmland is mostly{cattle}(milk and beef)and{arable. There are some{Tumuli}very near Kingsdown House and it is where some people were buried.Miss Pyke said that Kingsdown is so called because it used to be a{down}(or free land) and the {King}was supposed to own it all. Nearby,too, is an area called{Blue {Vein-}named after the bed-rock colour.
